title: STROPHIA
content:
STROPHIA was the Naiad-nymph of a spring of the town of Thebes in Boiotia (central Greece).

Callimachus, Hymn 4 to Delos 75 ff (trans. Mair) (Greek poet C3rd B.C.) :
        "[The rivers and springs flee before the pregnant goddess Leto, fearing the wrath of Hera should they
        provide her refuge :] Fled , too, Aonia [Boiotia] on the same course, and Dirke (Dirce) and Strophia [the two
        springs of Thebes], holding the hands of their sire, dark-pebbled Ismenos (Ismenus)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
